::Spears:;

She took a few steps back from the door, just out of Striker's reach, 
and turned her head and neck arond so he could view the chip.  The 
chip's control had also put in a perservation program.  She had no 
choice but to protect the chip that controlled her. She knew that she 
couldn't help Striker, but a thought did cross her mind.  She could 
give him one warning to him,"I will have to report your actions to 
Master Prebon."
 

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Striker::
> 
> Striker frowns, realizing that Spears wasn't going to help him any.
> 
> "Allright," he says again, starting to get a bit mad, "Can you at 
least turn 
> around so I can see the chip? I gotta see what it looks like."
> 
> He hoped she'd fall for it. He knew that it was the chip that was 
controlling 
> her, and he figured its destruction might free her.
